sentence1: Then the two animals took counsel together as to how they might restore to their owners their former good fortune.
sentence2: Then they started out together for home, in order to bring the lucky ring to their master and mistress.

sentence1: Then they started out together for home, in order to bring the lucky ring to their master and mistress.
sentence2: The cat, however, quickly climbed over the roof, and so she reached home long before the dog, and brought the ring to her master.

sentence1: The cat, however, quickly climbed over the roof, and so she reached home long before the dog, and brought the ring to her master.
sentence2: Then her master said to his wife: "What a good creature the cat is!

sentence1: Then her master said to his wife: "What a good creature the cat is!
sentence2: We will always give her enough to eat and care for her as though she were our own child!"

sentence1: We will always give her enough to eat and care for her as though she were our own child!"
sentence2: But when the dog came home they beat him and scolded him, because he had not helped to bring home the ring again.

sentence1: But when the dog came home they beat him and scolded him, because he had not helped to bring home the ring again.
sentence2: Then the dog grew angry at the cat, because she had robbed him of his reward, and when he saw her he chased her and tried to seize her.
